definitions: To cause (liquid) to strike or scatter over a surface or object.
To move through water, mud, or a similar liquid, causing it to fly about.
To make a splash or splashing sound.
To display (a story, photograph, or advertisement) in a prominent or sensational way.
examples: The children love to splash in the puddles.
He splashed water on his face.
The news was splashed across the front page.
A fish splashed in the pond.
